--- title: Spells keywords: fastai sidebar: home_sidebar summary: "Describe spells within sequences" description: "Describe spells within sequences" nb_path: "15_spells.ipynb" ---
{% raw %}
{% endraw %}

Overview

Spells are exclusively recurrent n-grams (the same element repeated a number of times), and are a useful prerequisite for a number of distance measures and other descriptive statistics. The spells module contains methods for understanding the prevalence and extremes of spells in sequences, plus some basic visualisation functionality.

Methods

{% raw %}

get_spells[source]

get_spells(sequence)

Returns a list of tuples where each tuple holds the element and the length of the spell (also known as run or episode) for each spell in the sequence.

{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
sequence = [1,1,2,1,2,2,3,1,1,2,2,1,2,2,3,1,1,2]
get_spells(sequence)

[(1, 2),
 (2, 1),
 (1, 1),
 (2, 2),
 (3, 1),
 (1, 2),
 (2, 2),
 (1, 1),
 (2, 2),
 (3, 1),
 (1, 2),
 (2, 1)]
{% endraw %} {% raw %}

get_longest_spell[source]

get_longest_spell(sequence)

Returns a dict containing the element, count, and starting position of the longest spell in the sequence. The keys of this dict are 'element, 'count', and 'start'.

{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
sequence = [1,1,2,1,2,2,3,1,1,2,2,1,2,2,3,1,1,2]
get_longest_spell(sequence)

{'element': 1, 'count': 2, 'start': 0}
{% endraw %} {% raw %}

get_spell_durations[source]

get_spell_durations(sequence)

Computes the durations of each spell in the sequence, returning a list. Note that this is a derivative of the sequence, so can be used as input for further analyses.

{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
sequence = [1,1,2,1,2,2,3,1,1,2,2,1,2,2,3,1,1,2]
get_spell_durations(sequence)

[2, 1, 1, 2, 1, 2, 2, 1, 2, 1, 2, 1]
{% endraw %}
